free_txt: BP: Updated to new date formats, lower
case. Corrections according last EXFOR rules and Dict.
Updated data, digitized Figs. 3-4, added Kerma factor.

bib_record.title: The 12-C(n,alpha) Reaction and the Kerma Factor for Carbon at En = 14.1 MeV

free_txt: Data corrected for background and energy loss in
delta-E proportional counters followed by an 'E'
solid-state counter. The spectrometer consisted of
400 keV deuterons impinged on a rotating,thick,
tritium-loaded titanium target. The 14.1 MeV neutrons
produced had an energy spread of 0.15 MeV at 90
degree relative to the deuteron beam.
CH2 foil, CD2 foil and He cell were used to measure
the 14.1 MeV elastic scattering cross section for
The angle integrated cross section obtained
from the Legendre polynomial fit to the measured data.
The continuum alpha-particle cross section below the
(n,alpha-0) peak was fitted with Legendre polynomials
to obtain the angle integrated alpha emission cross
Uncertainty due to the extrapolation of
the angle-integrated cross section from lowest
energies measured to zero energy was 50 percent of
The spectra were extrapolated to zero alpha-particle
energy by a horizontal straight line.
The partial kerma factor was obtained simply from the
products of the cross section times the energy
available, namely the incident energy plus the Q-value
